p: The flavonoids and phenolic compounds present in the essential oil of H. suaveolens exhibit strong antibacterial activity against pathogenic Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria such as Staphylococcus aureus, Salmonella typhi, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Lactobacillus plantarum, Escherichia coli, Vibrio vulnificus, Enterococcus fecalis, and Streptococcus fecalis [ 26, 29]. But the antibacterial efficacy of phenolics and flavonoids present in essential oil of H. suaveolens is more pronounced in Gram-positive bacteria as compare to that of Gram-negative bacteria due to the presence of outer hydrophilic membrane in latter [ 53, 77, 78].
